meanings.definition: A type of steroid hormone that is produced by the adrenal cortex and is involved in regulating glucose metabolism and suppressing inflammation.
meanings.sent1: The doctor prescribed a glucocorticoid to reduce inflammation in my joints.
meanings.sent2: Glucocorticoids play a crucial role in controlling blood sugar levels.
meanings.sent3: I heard glucocorticoids can make you feel like a superhero with their anti-inflammatory powers.
meanings.sent4: Her influence on the team was like that of a glucocorticoid, calming tensions and restoring balance.
meanings.sent5: The image of a glucocorticoid as a guardian against inflammation stuck in my mind.

meanings.definition: Any synthetic or natural compound that mimics the actions of glucocorticoids in the body.
meanings.sent1: Athletes sometimes use synthetic glucocorticoids to enhance performance.
meanings.sent2: The herbal supplement was believed to act as a natural glucocorticoid.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a mimic glucocorticoid in the body sounded like a science fiction plot.
meanings.sent4: Her words had the effect of a mimic glucocorticoid, soothing the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The concept of a mimic glucocorticoid was both fascinating and puzzling to the students.
